nodes.text: Grow 200 ml yeast cells expressing V5-His6 tagged protein in YPG \(yeast extract/peptone/galactose) to A600 of approximately 0.6

slots.value: 200 ml yeast cells expressing V5-His6 tagged protein

emits.value: 200 ml yeast cells expressing V5-His6 tagged protein

nodes.text: After UV \(100 J/m2) or mock treatment, incubate cells at 30 °C in the dark for one hour
Add formaldehyde directly to the culture to 1% \(final concentration).

slots.value: 200 ml yeast cells expressing V5-His6 tagged protein

nodes.text: incubate cells for 20 min at room temperature
quench cross-linking by addition of 0.5 M glycine \(final concentration)
wash cells with cold Tris-buffered saline followed by cold lysis buffer \(50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5, 10 mM MgCl2, 200 mM KCl, 0.1 mM EDTA, 10% glycerol and 1% Triton X-100).

Resuspend approximately 0.5 ml yeast cells in 1 ml of lysis buffer containing 1 mM
phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride and protease inhibitor mixture

slots.value: lysis buffer containing 1 mM phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride and protease inhibitor mixture

nodes.text: Disrupt the cells by votexing in the presence of 0.5 ml glass beads
Sonicate the lysate \(the average size of DNA fragments should be less than 1 kb)
centrifuge cells for 20 min at 10,000 g
incubate 0.5ml cell-free extracts \(approximately 20 mg/ml protein) and 0.1 ml Ni-NTA-Agarose beads overnight at 4 °C
Transfer the beads to a 2 ml tube
wash three times with 1.5 ml lysis buffer, three times with 1.5 ml of the same buffer but with 20 mM imidazol and twice with 1.5 ml of TE \(10 mM Tris-Page 3/4 HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA)
wash three times with 1.5 ml lysis buffer, three times with 1.5 ml of the same buffer but with 20 mM imidazol and twice with 1.5 ml of TE \(10 mM Tris-Page 3/4 HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA)
wash three times with 1.5 ml lysis buffer, three times with 1.5 ml of the same buffer but with 20 mM imidazol and twice with 1.5 ml of TE \(10 mM Tris-Page 3/4 HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA)

slots.value: 1.5 ml of TE (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA)

nodes.text: Transfer the beads to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube with TE and pellet
Transfer the beads to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube with TE and pellet
Add SDS-PAGE sample buffer \(2x, 0.1 ml) and cross-links reversed by boiling for 20 min
Add SDS-PAGE sample buffer \(2x, 0.1 ml) and cross-links reversed by boiling for 20 min
Analyze samples by Western blotting using antibodies specific for DNA repair proteins Rad4 and Rad23
Strip the PVDF membrane and reprobe with V5 antibody
Strip the PVDF membrane and reprobe with V5 antibody
Use the detected Snf6-V5His6 and/or LacZ-V5His6 as loading controls
To purify TAP-tagged Rad4, incubate Human IgG-Agarose beads \(0.1 ml, sigma) with 0.5 ml cell-free extracts overnight at 4 °C
Transfer the beads to a 2 ml tube

wash beads three times with 1.5 ml lysis buffer
and twice with 1.5 ml of TE \(10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA)

wash beads three times with 1.5 ml lysis buffer
and twice with 1.5 ml of TE \(10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA)

slots.value: TE (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA)

nodes.text: Add SDS-PAGE sample buffer \(2x, 0.1 ml) and cross-links reversed by boiling for 20 min
Add SDS-PAGE sample buffer \(2x, 0.1 ml) and cross-links reversed by boiling for 20 min
Analyze samples by Western blotting using antibodies specific for DNA repair proteins Rad4 and Rad23
To perform DNase I digestion, resuspend 0.01ml washed Ni-NTA-Agarose beads  in 0.2 ml 1X DNase I buffer and treat with 5 units of DNaseI \(New England Biolabs) for 3 hours at 37 °C.
To perform DNase I digestion, resuspend 0.01ml washed Ni-NTA-Agarose beads  in 0.2 ml 1X DNase I buffer and treat with 5 units of DNaseI \(New England Biolabs) for 3 hours at 37 °C.
Wash beads twice with 1.5 ml of TE \(10 mM Tris-HCl, pH8.0, 1 mM EDTA)

slots.value: TE (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH8.0, 1 mM EDTA)

nodes.text: Incubate cell-free extracts \(0.5 ml, approximately 20 mg/ml protein) and 0.1 ml Ni-NTA-Agarose beads \(Qiagen) overnight at 4 °C in the presence of various amount of ethidium bromide \(from 0.05 to 0.5 mg/ml

slots.value: cell-free extracts (0.5 ml, approximately 20 mg/ml protein)
in the presence of various amount of ethidium bromide (from 0.05 to 0.5 mg/ml)

nodes.text: Wash Ni-NTA-agarose beads gently three times with the following buffer: 25mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5, 50 \(or 200) mM KCl, 10% glycerol

slots.value: buffer: 25mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5, 50 (or 200) mM KCl, 10% glycerol

nodes.text: Transfer the beads to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube with TE and pellet.
Transfer the beads to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube with TE and pellet.
Add SDS-PAGE sample buffer \(2x, 0.1 ml) and cross-links reversed by boiling for 20 min.
Add SDS-PAGE sample buffer \(2x, 0.1 ml) and cross-links reversed by boiling for 20 min.
Analyze samples by Western blotting using antibodies specific for DNA repair proteins Rad4 and Rad23
